> It is important to group your tests in various categories,
> which can represent several different things depending on
> your emphasis.  For example, you can have "database" tests,
> "front-end" tests, "security" tests, etc...

I find that grouping my *production* code in functional modules and just
running the tests of the modules I worked on already works sufficiently
well. And I think that speeding up the tests actually is even more
important.

YMMV, as always.

Cheers, Ilja
